hanzi-su-wiki:
牽

Значения

Тянуть, тащить

Мнемоника

Искажено. Тащить быка 牛 за рога на верёвке 幺 (элемент дан в прямом и зеркальном отображении). Покрывало 冖 символизирует упорство быка.

Варианты

牵
purpleculture_pinyin:
qiān
to lead along; to pull (an animal on a tether); (bound form) to involve; to draw in
вести за собой; тянуть (животное на привязи); (связанная форма) привлекать; втянуть
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 牵)
Ideographic: A person pulling 冖 an ox 牛 by a rope 玄
purpleculture_examples:
牽頭 [ qiān tóu ]: to lead (an animal by the head); to take the lead; to coordinate (a combined operation); to mediate; a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
牽動 [ qiān dòng ]: to affect; to produce a change in sth
牽掛 [ qiān guà ]: to worry about; to be concerned about
牽引 [ qiān yǐn ]: to pull; to draw (a cart); to tow
牽涉 [ qiān shè ]: to involve; implicated

heisig_chinese_memo: Put on the mysterious crown and you will lead along cows because they will start to follow the crown no matter what you do. &nbsp
Keyword_KANJIDIC: pull, tug, drag, lead by hand
Ru_trainchinese: qiān: (глаг) вести, тянуть за собой; вовлекать, впутывать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the cow (牛) is covered (冖) with mystery (玄) until you pull it off
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The biggest cow has a crown and has to lead along the others.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " bull ", like the reins of the bull to lead the bull, the sound of " xuan ", the original meaning is pull and pull. "Shuowen": "Yiqianyan. From the cow, like the oxen, the sound is mysterious." "Shu‧jiujiao": "When you start a car, you will serve Jia, and you will raise your parents with filial piety."

" Leading " can refer to cattle, sheep, hogs and other livestock. "The Thirty-three Years of Zuo Zhuan·Xi Gong": "My son has been flooded in the town for a long time, but the money is exhausted." Du's pre-note: "Leading means cattle, sheep, and hogs." Kong Yingda Shu: "Cattle, Sheep and hog can be led, so it is said that "to lead the ox and sheep" is also."

" Tang " also refers to containment. "Guanzi·Fafa": "Orders to go out but not to do is called pull." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Look, pull on the left and right."

" Involvement " also implies involvement and involvement. "Selected Works‧Zhang Heng (Xijing Fu)": "The lady is comfortable when she is in the sun, and she is miserable when she is in the yin." Xue Zong's note: "Tang, you are still connected.

" Qian " also means ancient place names. Ancient place names. "The Fourteenth Year of the Spring and Autumn Period": "The Guild Qihou, Weihou Yuqian." Du Yuqian: "There is Qiancheng in the northeast of Liyang County, Wei County."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " bull ", like the reins of the bull that leads the bull, the sound " xuan ", the original meaning is pull and pull.
humanum_full_description:
從「牛」， 象引牛的牛繮繩，「玄」聲，本義為拉、挽。《說文》：「引前也。从牛，象引牛之縻也，玄聲。」 《書‧酒誥》：「肇牽車牛，遠服賈，用孝養厥父母。」

　　「牽」可指牛、羊、豕等牲畜。《左傳‧僖公三十三年》：「吾子淹久於敝邑，唯是脯資餼牽竭矣。」杜預注：「牽，謂牛、羊、豕。」孔穎達疏：「牛、羊、豕可牽行，故云『牽謂牛羊豕』也。」

　　「牽」還指牽制。《管子‧法法》：「令出而不行謂之牽。」尹知章注：「牽，牽于左右。」

　　「牽」也表示牽連、牽涉。《文選‧張衡〈西京賦〉》：「夫人在陽時則舒，在陰時則慘，此牽乎天者也。」薛綜注：「牽，猶繫也。」

　　「牽」亦表示古地名。古地名。《春秋‧定公十四年》：「公會齊侯、衛侯于牽。」杜預注：「魏郡黎陽縣東北有牽城。」
humanum_short_description: 從「牛」， 象引牛的牛繮繩，「玄」聲，本義為拉、挽。

①拉，引領向前：牽引。牽曳。牽頭。牽線。牽蘿補屋(把蘿藤拉上屋頂來補草房，形容生活困難，亦喻將就湊合)。
②關連，帶累：牽連。牽強(勉強牽連在一起)。意惹情牽。

Chinese: Put on the mysterious crown and you will lead along cows because they will start to follow the crown no matter what you do.  
Meaning: lead along
Hanzi: 牵
Story: The biggest cow has a crown and has to lead along the others.
Kind: traditional

從「 牛 」， 象引牛的牛繮繩，「 玄 」聲，本義為拉、挽。《說文》：「引前也。从牛，象引牛之縻也，玄聲。」 《書‧酒誥》：「肇牽車牛，遠服賈，用孝養厥父母。」 「 牽 」可指牛、羊、豕等牲畜。《左傳‧僖公三十三年》：「吾子淹久於敝邑，唯是脯資餼牽竭矣。」杜預注：「牽，謂牛、羊、豕。」孔穎達疏：「牛、羊、豕可牽行，故云『牽謂牛羊豕』也。」 「 牽 」還指牽制。《管子‧法法》：「令出而不行謂之牽。」尹知章注：「牽，牽于左右。」 「 牽 」也表示牽連、牽涉。《文選‧張衡〈西京賦〉》：「夫人在陽時則舒，在陰時則慘，此牽乎天者也。」薛綜注：「牽，猶繫也。」 「 牽 」亦表示古地名。古地名。《春秋‧定公十四年》：「公會齊侯、衛侯于牽。」杜預注：「魏郡黎陽縣東北有牽城。」
From the " bull", like the reins of the bull to lead the bull, the sound of " xuan", the original meaning is pull and pull. "Shuowen": "Yiqianyan. From the cow, like the oxen, the sound is mysterious." "Shu‧jiujiao": "When you start a car, you will serve Jia, and you will raise your parents with filial piety." " Leading" can refer to cattle, sheep, hogs and other livestock. "The Thirty-three Years of Zuo Zhuan·Xi Gong": "My son has been flooded in the town for a long time, but the money is exhausted." Du's pre-note: "Leading means cattle, sheep, and hogs." Kong Yingda Shu: "Cattle, Sheep and hog can be led, so it is said that "to lead the ox and sheep" is also." " Tang" also refers to containment. "Guanzi·Fafa": "Orders to go out but not to do is called pull." Yin Zhizhang's note: "Look, pull on the left and right." " Involvement" also implies involvement and involvement. "Selected Works‧Zhang Heng (Xijing Fu)": "The lady is comfortable when she is in the sun, and she is miserable when she is in the yin." Xue Zong's note: "Tang, you are still connected. " Qian" also means ancient place names. Ancient place names. "The Fourteenth Year of the Spring and Autumn Period": "The Guild Qihou, Weihou Yuqian." Du Yuqian: "There is Qiancheng in the northeast of Liyang County, Wei County."

牽字的基本解释

牽
qiān
见“牵”。

牽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiān］
［《廣韻》苦堅切，平先，溪。］
亦作“撁1”。“牵1”的繁体字。
(1)拉，挽。
(2)指牛、羊、豕。
(3)带领；引导。
(4)引。
(5)挂；牵挂。
(6)牵连；牵涉。
(7)牵累。
(8)牵制。
(9)拘泥。
(10)古地名。
(11)姓。汉有兖州刺史牵颢。见《後汉书·皇甫规传》。
[②]［qiàn］
［《廣韻》苦甸切，去霰，溪。］
同“縴1”。“牵2”的繁体字。
挽船的绳索。

牽字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【牛字部】　牽； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页701第02
〔古文〕摼?【唐韻】苦堅切【集韻】【韻會】輕煙切，?音岍。【說文】引前也。从牛，象引牛之縻也。【易·夬卦】牽羊悔亡。【書·酒誥】肇牽車牛。【禮·曲禮】效馬效羊者，右牽之。效犬者，左牽之。　又【周禮·天官·小宰】掌其牢禮，委積膳獻飮食賔賜之飱牽。【註】飱，夕食也。牽，牲牢可牽而行者。【左傳·僖三十三年】惟是脯資餼牽竭矣。【註】牽，謂牛羊豕。　又【玉篇】挽也。【左傳·襄十年】牽帥老夫，以至於此。　又【玉篇】連也。【易·小畜】九二牽復吉。【疏】牽謂牽連。　又【玉篇】速也。【禮·學記】君子之敎喩也，道而勿牽。【疏】牽謂牽逼人。苟不曉知，亦不偪急，牽令速曉也。　又【管子·法法篇】令出而不行，謂之牽。　又拘也。【史記·六國表】學者牽於所聞。　又牽牛，星名。【禮·月令】旦牽牛中。　又地名。【春秋·定十四年】公會齊侯衞侯于牽。【註】魏郡黎陽縣東北有牽城。　又人名。【左傳·成十七年】鮑牽見之。　又姓。【後漢·皇甫規傳】實賴兗州刺史牽顥之淸猛。　又【廣韻】苦甸切【集

Lead
Basic explanation of words
Lead
qiān
See "pull".
Lead
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiān］
["Guangyun" bitter and hard cut, flat first, stream. ]
Also known as "push 1". The traditional characters of "pin1".
(1) Pull, pull.
(2) Refers to cattle, sheep, and hog.
(3) Lead; guide.
(4) Cited.
(5) Hang; worry.
(6) Implicated; involved.
(7) Involvement.
(8) Containment.
(9) Feelings.
(10) Ancient place names.
(11) Last name. There is a history of Yanzhou governor in the Han Dynasty. See "Book of the Later Han·Huangfu Rules Biography".
[②]［qiàn］
["Guangyun" bitterly cut, go to Cha, Xi. ]
Same as "Fiber 1". The traditional characters of "pin 2".
The ropes of the boat.
Lead
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Ji 2] [Bull Character Department] 　 Qian; Kangxi strokes: 11; Page number: page 701 02
[Ancient text] 摼? [Tang Yun] bitter and hard cut [Jiyun] [Rhyme] light smoke cut,? Yin 岍. [Said the text] also cited before. From the cattle, the elephant leads the cattle. [Yi·Huan Gua] Leading sheep regrets death. 【Book·Liquor】Zhao Qian Che Niu. 【Rite·Curly】If you imitate the horse and the sheep, lead it with the right. If you are a dog, lead it from the left.　[Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Xiao Zai】handed his prison ceremony, commissioned to accumulate food and gluttonous bladder gift. [Note] 飱, evening food. To be led, the prisoner can be led by the walker. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Thirty-three Years] However, the resources are exhausted. 【Note】Leading is called cattle, sheep and hog.　[Jade articles] Wan Ye. [Zuo Zhuan·Xiang Ten Years] Leading the handsome old man, so much so.　[Jade articles] Lian Ye. 【Easy·Xiao Hu】Ji Er Qiang Fu Ji. 【Sparse】Involvement means implicated.　[Jade articles] Su Ye. 【Ritual·Xue Ji】The gentleman's love is not to be led by the way. 【Sparse】to pull and force people. Gou doesn't know what to know, and he doesn't press for urgency.　[Guanzi·Fafa Chapter] Ordering out and failing, it is called drag.　It's also restrained. 【Historical Records · Six Kingdoms】Scholars are influenced by what they hear.　Alternatively, star name. 【Ritual·Monthly Order】Once in the midst of pulling the bull.　Also place name. [Spring and Autumn·Fourteen Years] Guild Qihou Wei Hou Yuqian. [Note] There is Qiancheng in the northeast of Liyang County, Wei County.　Another name. [Zuo Zhuan·Seventeen Years] Bao Qianjianzhi.　Another last name. [The Houhan·Huangfu Regulations Biography] It really depends on the fierce influence of the Yanzhou provincial governor.　 [Guang Yun] bitter cut [set]
